Master Answer:
85-95% of infants immunized at 12-15 months of age with the measles, mumps, rubella (MMR) vaccine will develop antibodies. The MMR vaccine is scheduled at 12 months and 4-6 years of age. If you have specific concerns about you/your family and an exposure to a measles case, please contact your local health unit. Find the location near you here.
Immunization Nurse
Master Question: I have a 13 month old who had his 12 month vaccinations last month. Given the recent measles cases, are you recommending bumping up the 2nd MMR vaccine ? I have read that a second dose can be given if more than 28 days has past between vaccinations.
Master Question variation 0: how long after vaccines can you give a second shot
Master Question variation 1: can you bump up mrm vaccine after measles vaccinations
